profile.name: Daenerys Targaryen
profile.currentTitle: Queen of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and the First Men
profile.summary: From stateless refugee to sovereign of the largest military force in the known world. Built an empire from zero assets through liberation movements, strategic conquests, and an unshakable vision of a better world. Commanded three dragons, an army of formerly enslaved soldiers, and a Dothraki horde — scaling from nothing to continental power in under eight years. The ultimate founder story.

skills.name: Visionary Leadership
evidence: Articulated a compelling vision of liberation that recruited armies, advisors, and entire cities to her cause
Maintained strategic direction across an 8-year campaign spanning two continents and dozens of military engagements
Inspired loyalty from culturally diverse followers — Dothraki, Unsullied, Essosi freedmen, and Westerosi lords — through shared purpose

skills.name: Scaling Operations
evidence: Grew from a single khalasar to commanding the largest combined military force in known history
Scaled governance from a single city (Meereen) to preparation for continental rule
Built organizational infrastructure — advisors, commanders, supply chains — to support exponential growth

skills.name: Military Strategy
evidence: Conquered three slave cities (Astapor, Yunkai, Meereen) through distinct tactical approaches — deception, siege, and infiltration
Unified Dothraki khalasars under single command — the first leader to do so since Khal Menin
Executed combined-arms warfare integrating dragon air power, cavalry, and infantry at the Battle of the Goldroad

skills.name: Force Projection
evidence: Deployed three dragons as strategic weapons — fundamentally changing the military calculus of every engagement
Used dragon demonstrations as diplomatic leverage — the threat of force as substitute for its use
Projected military power across the Narrow Sea through naval logistics and alliance with Yara Greyjoy's Iron Fleet

skills.name: Liberation Strategy
evidence: Freed the Unsullied of Astapor through a tactical deception that simultaneously acquired an army and destroyed a slave market
Liberated Meereen through alliance with enslaved populations who opened the city from within
Built a political movement around abolition that attracted followers from across Essos

skills.name: Social Transformation
evidence: Abolished slavery across Slaver's Bay — restructuring an entire regional economy
Attempted to build new social institutions in Meereen including courts, labor systems, and civil governance
Navigated the backlash of economic disruption from abolition including insurgency, economic collapse, and foreign intervention

skills.name: Coalition Building
evidence: United the Unsullied, Dothraki, Dornish, Greyjoy, and Tyrell forces under a single command structure
Secured alliance with Jon Snow and the North through negotiation, mutual respect, and shared threat assessment
Built advisor corps spanning multiple cultures — Tyrion (Westerosi), Missandei (Naathi), Grey Worm (Astapori), Jorah (Northern)

skills.name: Diplomatic Communication
evidence: Negotiated with the Masters of Yunkai, the leaders of Qarth, and Westerosi lords across multiple diplomatic contexts
Used titles and ceremony as diplomatic tools — projecting legitimate authority before it was fully established
Communicated in Dothraki, High Valyrian, and Common Tongue — adapting language and register to audience

skills.name: Crisis Leadership
evidence: Survived the destruction of her khalasar, assassination attempts, and military defeats without losing strategic coherence
Led the defense of Winterfell against the Army of the Dead — committing her forces to an existential fight not her own
Made real-time tactical decisions during the Battle of King's Landing including deployment of Drogon against fortified defenses

skills.name: Talent Identification
evidence: Recognized Jorah Mormont's value despite his betrayal — ultimately accepting him back after he proved his loyalty
Appointed Tyrion Lannister as Hand despite his family being her sworn enemies — correctly assessing his strategic value
Identified Missandei's diplomatic and linguistic capabilities and elevated her from translator to chief advisor

skills.name: Brand Building
evidence: Built 'Breaker of Chains' brand that preceded her — cities opened their gates based on reputation alone
Used dragon imagery, ceremony, and spectacle to project power beyond her actual military reach
Created a personal brand so compelling that people crossed continents to serve her cause

skills.name: Insurgency Management
evidence: Fought the Sons of the Harpy insurgency in Meereen through combined military and political approaches
Learned that military conquest without institutional governance creates power vacuums that breed resistance
Adapted counterinsurgency strategy from pure force to political compromise — opening fighting pits as concession

skills.name: Resource Acquisition
evidence: Acquired the Unsullied army through tactical deception costing zero gold
United all Dothraki khalasars by demonstrating power through fire — converting rivals into followers
Secured ships, supplies, and allies through a combination of negotiation, demonstration, and strategic marriage

skills.name: Public Speaking
evidence: Delivered speeches in multiple languages that moved crowds of thousands to immediate action
Used rhetoric of liberation and justice to build loyalty more durable than any political arrangement
Spoke to the Dothraki in their language about their destiny — earning respect that previous leaders demanded through combat

skills.name: Governance Design
evidence: Attempted to design new economic and social systems for post-slavery Meereen
Established courts, appointed administrators, and created civil infrastructure in conquered cities
Struggled with the gap between revolutionary vision and institutional governance — a common founder challenge

skills.name: Naval Strategy
evidence: Coordinated naval transport of 100,000+ troops across the Narrow Sea
Secured Greyjoy fleet alliance providing naval superiority for the Westeros campaign
Understood the strategic importance of Dragonstone as naval staging point for continental invasion

skills.name: Cross-Cultural Leadership
evidence: Led organizations spanning Dothraki, Unsullied, Westerosi, Naathi, and other cultures simultaneously
Adapted leadership style from Dothraki warrior-queen to Meereenese ruler to Westerosi sovereign
Built trust across cultural boundaries through shared mission rather than shared heritage

skills.name: Supply Chain Management
evidence: Managed logistics for continental-scale military campaigns including food, arms, and transport
Organized the feeding and supply of a combined army of Dothraki and Unsullied during the march North
Dealt with supply disruption when Euron Greyjoy destroyed her fleet — adapting logistics in real-time

skills.name: Resilience
evidence: Survived assassination by the warlocks of Qarth, the Sons of the Harpy, and multiple military defeats
Rebuilt her power base from near-zero after being separated from her army and stranded in the Dothraki Sea
Lost her husband, two of her dragons, her closest advisor, and her claim to the throne — continuing forward each time

skills.name: Succession & Legacy Planning
evidence: Struggled to define succession plan given her belief in her own inability to bear heirs
Failed to build institutional structures that could outlast her personal rule
Acknowledged the limitation — 'break the wheel' vision was about systems, not dynasties — but implementation lagged

purpose: To break the wheel of power that crushes the people beneath it — building a world where no one is property and everyone has a voice.

workHistory.title: Queen of the Seven Kingdoms
workHistory.description: Led invasion of Westeros. United forces against the Night King at the Battle of Winterfell. Conquered King's Landing.

workHistory.title: Queen of Meereen
workHistory.description: Governed Meereen after liberation. Abolished slavery, fought Sons of the Harpy insurgency, established civil institutions. Built combined military force for Westeros campaign.

workHistory.title: Liberator & Conqueror
workHistory.description: Conquered Astapor, Yunkai, and Meereen. Freed hundreds of thousands of enslaved people. Acquired the Unsullied army and built a liberation movement that reshaped the region.

workHistory.title: Khaleesi
workHistory.description: Rose from political marriage to leadership of a 40,000-strong Dothraki khalasar. Hatched three dragons — the first in over 150 years. Began building the coalition that would conquer a continent.

workHistory.title: Exile
workHistory.description: Stateless refugee, sheltered by allies in the Free Cities. Survived assassination attempts, political manipulation, and the psychological abuse of her brother Viserys.

education.field: Military Strategy, Governance, Languages, Dragon Husbandry
